SEARCH
Package LoginPage

Class Login

java.lang.Object
LoginPage.Login
public class Login extends Object
The Login class manages the login process for users of the Hospital App. This includes: - Authenticating user credentials. - Retrieving forgotten user IDs based on user-provided information. - Delegating post-login functionality to relevant menu classes. The class prioritizes secure password handling and user-friendly prompts, ensuring accessibility and robustness.

  • Constructor Details

    • Login

      public Login()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws FileNotFoundException
      Starts the login process by displaying the initial menu options. Prompts the user for their choice to log in, retrieve a user ID, or exit.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the login file is not found

    • makeChoice

      public String makeChoice()
      Handles the user's menu choice and directs them to the appropriate action. Options include logging in, retrieving a user ID, or exiting the system.
      Returns:
      the user ID if login is successful, otherwise null

    • login

      public String login()
      Handles user login by verifying credentials against the stored data.
      Returns:
      the user ID if login is successful, otherwise null

    • verifyPassword

      public static boolean verifyPassword(String password, String salt, String storedHash) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Verifies the provided password against the stored hash using PBKDF2 with HMAC SHA-256.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to be verified
      salt - the salt used during the password hashing process
      storedHash - the stored hash to compare against
      Returns:
      true if the password matches the stored hash, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the specified algorithm is not available
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is invalid

    • retrieveUserID

      public boolean retrieveUserID(Scanner sc)
      Retrieves the user ID based on the provided full name. Prompts the user to enter their full name and searches for a matching user ID in the login file.
      Parameters:
      sc - the Scanner object used to read user input
      Returns:
      true if the user ID is found, otherwise false

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu(String ID)
      Prints the menu for the application based on the provided user ID. If the ID is valid, it delegates the display to the MenuManager; otherwise, it shows an error message.
      Parameters:
      ID - the user ID used to display the appropriate menu
